bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Crown timber to be used in British Columbia
bcl:section.bcl:text: Unless exempted under this Part, timber that is harvested from Crown land, from land granted by the government after March 12, 1906 or from land granted by the government before March 12, 1906 in a tree farm licence area, and wood residue produced from the timber, must be

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: manufactured in British Columbia into wood products to the extent of manufacture specified by regulation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Attempt to export timber or wood residue
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person must not attempt to remove from British Columbia

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: land granted by the government after March 12, 1906, or
land granted by the government before March 12, 1906 in a tree farm licence area, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: wood residue produced from timber referred to in paragraph (a),

bcl:section.bcl:text: unless the timber or wood residue is exempted under this Part.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may exempt from section 127

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a species of timber or kind of wood residue and may limit the volume of a species of timber or kind of wood residue to which the exemption applies for a period or for successive periods of time, and
a volume of timber, whether or not harvested, or a volume of a wood residue, on receiving an application in a form required by the minister.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On receiving an application in the form required by the minister, the minister may exempt from section 127

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a volume of timber that has been harvested, not exceeding 15 000 m3 for each application, and
a volume of wood residue, not exceeding 200 000 bone dry units for each application.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An exemption must not be given under this section unless the Lieutenant Governor in Council or the minister, as the case may be, is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the timber or wood residue will be surplus to requirements of timber processing facilities in British Columbia,

the timber or wood residue cannot be processed economically in the vicinity of the land from which it is cut or produced, and cannot be transported economically to a processing facility located elsewhere in British Columbia, or
the exemption would prevent the waste of or improve the utilization of timber cut from Crown land.

bcl:section.bcl:text: An exemption made under section 128 may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: stipulate conditions to be met and fees to be paid to the government, and
provide for the granting of a permit in respect of the timber or wood residue described in the exemption.
